Review.Titre: Started out as a fantastic experience, ended as a nightmare
Review.Contenu: Just discovered this site to buy speakers remplacement for a car. The first chat was with Chuck and the guy was wonderful, gave me great advices and found exactly what i needed. So i ordered. I paid with my US credit card for the order, that i was supposed to receive before christmas, until there, everything is good. BUT things got bad when i wanted to make a shipping to a friend's P.O. Box, as this was a Christmas gift. They absolutely wanted to talk to the owner of the P.O. Box, to make sure that this person was aware that a shipment was made to the this box. They sent me e-mails like a was a scam, they called me, and after discussions, i gave them the phone number of the P.O. Box owner (even if this will the the christmas surprise gift) And they never even contacted her. Saying i had to provide another address for delivery. But in the end, who cares? i already paid for my order, can i decide where i want to ship it? Or even to who i want to ship it? So i asked for a refund and i will buy somewhere else. What started out great, went bad. I still don't understand why. Too bad for this christmas gift. Never again Crutchfield for me, i'm sorry.

Review.Titre: No Care for Repeat or New Customers

The purchase was 3 weeks outside of the return period, but I was hoping they could give me store credit as I would probably purchase items for my new vehicle when purchased. I was told there was nothing that could be done.This showed me that they only care about making money, and not the customers they make their money off of. All items were unopened and sealed.Please beware that once an item has been purchased their level of care for customers is none.

Detail tracking, and Crutchfield's own tracking page, indicates it sat at their dock 4 calendar days AND will not deliver for a full week. So the question posed initially remains. How is it you "sell" same day shipping/2 day service to WA state but don't provide it? And then, secondary, respond with false information?Order #52474837. When I placed the order it said "will ship today if ordered within the next 20 minutes". I placed the order right then and now 4 days later (Fri-Monday) package only has a shipping label applied at origin - not picked up yet. I usually have no issues with Crutchfield but why tell a customer something that isn't true?

While Crutchfield promotes self-installation as a cost-saving measure, the process falls short for complex setups and lacks the promised level of custom support. Customers should be aware of potential complications and hidden costs before proceeding.Key Concerns:Misleading Information: Crutchfield's "Custom" installation instructions are not truly specific to individual car and radio configurations. Additionally, instructions for accessory parts often lack clear guidance and require referencing separate manuals, creating confusion and frustration.Limited Support: Customer support representatives often refer customers back to existing documentation, even when the specific information is unclear or missing. Moreover, support abruptly ends at closing hours, leaving customers without assistance during critical troubleshooting steps.Return Fees: In case of product issues or dissatisfaction, Crutchfield imposes restocking fees, further adding to the financial burden of a failed installation attempt.Complex Installation Nightmare: For complex setups, the self-installation process can become a time-consuming and frustrating ordeal, negating any potential cost savings.Recommendation:For complex installations, engaging with a professional installer at another store offering free or low-cost installation services is strongly recommended. This ensures proper installation, avoids potential headaches, and guarantees accountability for any issues.Overall:While Crutchfield's self-installation option may appeal to technically inclined individuals with simple setups, the lack of truly customized instructions, limited support, and potential restocking fees make it a risky proposition for complex installations. Customers should carefully consider these factors before choosing Crutchfield for their car audio installation needs.

Review.Titre: Item missing, lack of updates, confusing/conflicting responses by Crutchfield Canada & UPS.
Review.Contenu: Purchased 2 items. One item arrived, which I don't actually need. The other item appears to be lost in transit, there was no update beyond the first scan by UPS in Concord, ON. Crutchfield Canada has been slow to recognize something had gone wrong, requiring multiple calls from me. They could not, and as of now, have not confirmed with me if the item was actually shipped out by their warehouse, saying that it would "be a few days to find out". The UPS tracking number sat idle for a week after the initial scan on 11th October 2023, changed to 'We've begun an investigation to locate the package' a week later, and now reports 'Investigation ClosedYour investigation has been closed with a proof of delivery.'I have checked with UPS customer support, and they say that their systems show the investigation as ongoing, and not closed. Quite significantly disappointed in Crutchfield Canada and UPS. I do not know if/when the package will be located, had it actually been shipped, I do not know if/when I will receive the item I ordered, nor do I know how long it will take to get a refund should that be the only option. So far, this has been quite terrible.---Nov 6th: UPS has since confirmed the package as missing. Crutchfield re-shipped the item from their USA warehouse as Crutchfield CA had run out of stock. This caused me to incur an additional charge of CAD$70. While I have the item which I ordered, I have to request reimbursement for the additional charge. The receipt for this charge has been forwarded to Crutchfield for reimbursement.

Review.Titre: Beware of this company if you live in Canada
Review.Contenu: I recently purchased a stereo and installation kit from crutchfield.ca for my truck. If you buy both at the same time you get a discount on the installation kit that makes it nearly free and you get free shipping. The stereo was nice but the installation kit didn't fit even though I talked to one of their advisers first. I called them and they told me I had to order a different installation kit from them but don't worry they would take care of it. So I ordered another kit, paid for it and the customer rep said he would remove the charge so it would be free. Two days later I noticed I was charged the full amount plus about $30 extra. I phoned and asked another customer rep what was the deal. She says that I had to pay for the new installation kit (I must have heard the other rep wrongly) and I had to pay the shipping to get it. When I heard this I said is it shipped yet, she said yes and then I said I was just going to send everything back. She said yes you can return everything but you have to pay to ship back everything to the United States and there would be a 15% restocking fee on top of that. This whole ordeal was a nightmare and their customer service just straight out lies to you.

I called UPS, they told me that I need to call the sender (crutchfield) to have them "request" the change of address. I did, then asked how long to take effect. "24 hours". hours later, no update. I've called UPS since, they tell me it will be delivered within a day, but that is impossible. the tracking status is the same (address change requested) and tomorrow is new year's eve. Forget it. will go somewhere else for my car audio from now on. suggest others do the same. all because of a simple TYPO and that crutchfield made the horrible decision to use UPS.

Review.Contenu: I purchased a router from them that didn't work, and they refused to give me bcash back and only gave me store credit after I returned it. I used the store credit + cash to buy another router, for $50 and that one didn't work either. Now they are telling me I will get $23 of my cash back, and they are keeping $10 as a 'shipping fee' they didn't tell me about, and give me a $10 coupon, and apparently they are just keeping the rest with no explanation.  Absolute scumbags.

Review.Titre: I ordered a 300$ head unit last year…
Review.Contenu: I ordered a 300$ head unit last year and installed in my truck, took it out and tried to install in my new truck and was having some trouble so I called to get help thru there tech line and the lady tells me I must have a order number to receive service i give her my my name and address and she couldn’t find it I went thru this with the manager as well so I bought a 300$ item and because the system lost data somewhere I was told there was nothing they could do I will never purchase anything from this company ever again.

Phone support was really exceptional. The tech knew exactly what I needed to complete the installation of my after-market car radio. Then, when the parts arrived as scheduled and on time, the enclosed instructions took me step by step through the whole installation. If you need electronics of any kind, Crutchfield is definitely the place to go!!!

Review.Titre: Defective Equipment, Inadequate Support - A Waste of Time
Review.Contenu: Crutchfield sold me $430 worth of stuff for my daughter's car, and the only thing that worked properly was the replacement faceplate.  The Alpine head unit and/or the Axxess interfaces randomly switched the view to the rear camera and could not be corrected (completely disabling the touchscreen interface), and the steering wheel controls never worked.  I lost a dozen hours trying to fix the problem(s) and two months of my life waiting for a resolution, and Crutchfield (and Alpine) was useless. I won't do business with Crutchfield again.

Bought a pre amped sub woofer from Crutchfield, they told me it was "excellent quality" and their house brand. I figured I would give it a shot...amp gave out with 60 days, they don't return for $ after that time, so store credit for me on something that's supposed to have a 3 year warranty. Was also told they would have to charge me 10% because I didn't keep the original box and ppaerwork it came with....whattt??? Will NEVER give Crutchfield my business again..ever.

Review.Titre: I recently bought the NOCO GB 150 and I…
Review.Contenu: I recently bought the NOCO GB 150 and I thought this product would jump start an RV battery but I was disappointed when it wouldn’t do a darn thing. I watched some YouTube videos about people that started cars and trucks that sat for years. I haven’t started my RV for a couple of years and the battery was bought in 2016 as new. I think I was sold junk.

I was ordering speakers for the dash of a 2015 jeep wrangler. It asked me all the information on my vehicle which I gave and also showed the diagram where the speakers went. When I touch the screen that shows the dash speakers the speakers I ordered came up on that page. To my surprise when I received  the speakers they were nowhere near the size I needed for the dash. you may want to correct your diagrams ,They are definitely in correct

Shipping 2 day guaranteed...not so much..once ups receive the product  then perhaps but it takes days for Crutchfield  to actually ship  the product...it sits  on a loaded  trailer until full ...3 full days before  Shipping  5 total  to receive  product...easier and less expensive to buy  locally ...never again  Crutchfield....

The products were correct and shipped quickly.  But the "installation instructions" were barely useful.  They helped only with taking out the old unit and mounting the new one.  Where the real help is needed IS THE WIRING!  Took me 2 DAYS for a job that should have taken 2 hours!  I don't know how anyone could get this working without past experience doing this (which I thankfully have).

Review.Titre: I spent a great deal of time on the…
Review.Contenu: I spent a great deal of time on the phone w/ these guys trying to find the radio that would fit my needs and my vehicle.  the one the person said would work would not when it arrived.  The service tech said he hated to be the bearer of bad news but no I did not have the right unit.  I sent the whole order back.  Won't do these folks again.

Your supposed installation instructions were a joke.  Had no instructions on how to wire in the steering wheel controls or by pass the parking brake.  This is the second time I have been burned by crutchfield.  Had wrong speaker mounts for my wife’s car last time I went thru crutchfield.  Will not do business with them again.

Horrible waste of time! Purchased here only because of good reviews re customer service and support, but OMG not the case. Twice sent out the wrong thing after having me email photos and spend time on the phone explaining exactly what's what but apparently the first support person just went on vacation and the second didn't hear a word I said. No one saw what the photos showed or I described. Let's see if the third person can send out anything I can use.

Where are my purchases? Two separate orders were placed on the same day and both are missing. It was due to arrive yesterday. No updates from your team.No tracking information, but you were sure to charge my credit card!!!

Review.Titre: I tried to order several car audio…
Review.Contenu: I tried to order several car audio receivers, but they were out of stock. So I searched and found one, and then wanted to order the ready-harness from Crutchfield. They treated me like a red-headed stepchild!!!  Very poor business model. They should be embarassed.

Review.Titre: Fast delivery promise of 2 business days is fake
Review.Contenu: I ordered the bazooka bta6100 and an additional wiring harness from one of their customer service agents and he promised me it would be at my house in 2 business days. After 3 business days I finally got my speaker and now I'm going on 4+ business days waiting for my wiring harness so I can actually use my order. Also the package is not discreet at all (big graphics saying it's a subwoofer) so if you order it be weary if you live in a neighborhood where someone stealing your package is a concern.

Great products,fast shipping, when my stereo arrived,along with my new stereo,also in the box was everything to remove my existing stereo and everything needed to install the new one!  Thanks to the entire  Crutchfield crew,for all you do! Look forward to doing  business with you in the near future! Thanks,Chris

I recently purchased installation hardware for a Pioneer touchscreen car stereo. I used crutchfield because they said they had complete information on trim disassembly/installation. Once i got into the project I realized their information was a joke. They don't tell you crap about wiring or different wiring options and the information to disassemble the dash trim was so basic I would of broke all the pieces. I finally found a youtube video someone else did that gave me enough information to complete it. I'm sorry I bought from them and will never do it again.

Review.Titre: They asked for my review too soon
Review.Contenu: They asked for my review too soon.  I gave them 5 stars.  They somehow lost my shipping address (which I had to give completely in order for my credit card payment to go through).  I only discovered this morning, when I checked to see what time today I should expect to receive the promised delivery.  Their tracking report said "Directions to the address are required to complete delivery. We are attempting to update this information. / The package will be returned to the sender." Looks like I should have bought from Amazon.

Review.Titre: The wrong wiring harness was sent with…
Review.Contenu: The wrong wiring harness was sent with my kit.  Now after splicing the harness together I will need to take everything out and get a new harness

BIG MISTAKE ODERING FROM CRUTCHFIELD. BEEN WAITING FOR 3 DAYS ON MY STUFF THAT THEY SAID WOULD BE DELIVERD BY A CERTAIN DATE. DECIDED TO INVESTIGATE AND FOUND OUT THEY CANCELED MY ORDER 7 DAYS AGO WITHOUT MY AUTHORIZATION. MY MONEY IS STILL TIED UP NOW BECAUSE ITS GOT A HOLDER ON IT AND I CANT REORDER. THIS HAS THROWN MY WHOLE SCHEDULE OUT OF WACK WITH MY CLIENT. IVE NEVER EXPERIENCED ANY TROUBLE ORDERING ONLINE TILL I TRIED CRUTCHFIELD. DO YOURSELVES A FAVOR. FIND ANOTHER SELLER WHO WONT CANCLE YOUR ORDER WITHOUT TELLING YOU LEAVING YOU HANG LIKE AN IDIOT.

Review.Titre: Order lost no help from Crutchfield.(updated)
Review.Contenu: I ordered items one week ago for two day delivery. Understanding that there are weather delays I waited a week to contact Crutch Field. According to UPS website my package is sitting in Atlanta and has not moved or been scanned in 48 hours. I chatted with Crutchfield this am and advised them that my package seemed to lost. According to the UPS website, they advised to contact the seller, Case (on line chat rep) said we need to give UPS the week before reaching out? Not the response I expected!Edit: Crutchfield has agreed to reship. I will update this when I recieve my package.

Review.Titre: No tech support for JVC/Maestro issues
Review.Contenu: I purchased a Double Din JVC system for my Yukon back in March 2021 with everything required to maintain factory controls.  I am very disappointed in the "Tech" support for the system. I have lost my rear audio controls as well as my inferred headphones after install.  I called Tech support twice and they didn't seem to know anymore than me.  They verified with me that the system is wired correctly by looking at the manual but that's where the support ended.  I was told that they were going to contact Maestro tech for assistance but I have not heard back and they won't respond to my email.

Review.Titre: So I ordered a car radio/gps radio
Review.Contenu: So I ordered a car radio/gps radio, they screwed up the address and had to call them to get ups to deliver it. Took 6 days for my 2 day shipping. I paid the $24.95 to have my harness wired and they left gps antenna out of the box. I called got an apology and they shipped it out on Monday. They again screwed up the address, after being assured the 1st time the issue was fixed. Here it is a week later no delivery. I called told them to get their antenna back from ups I’d order one from someone else. never again will I order anything from them! No customer service!

Review.Titre: Crutchfield poor service after the sale
Review.Contenu: Purchased new higher end Denon receiver because of the tech support services available. Had problems with our receiver from the beginning with no sound at times. Crutchfield was not willing to exchange the three week old unit and had no solutions to solve the problem other than to ship our new receiver into a service center at our expense. We could have ,  and now know , should have just purchased the Denon receiver from place with a better price as Crutchfield customer support isn't worth anything but a friendly person to socialize with on the phone.

This company is absolute garbage. I had ordered a Sonos Sound Beam and they sent it to the wrong address. After I called about it, they tried resending the package but it got lost in the mail somehow. After that they informed me that they would ship one in a week once they "had the inventory" for it. When it came down to the day, it had turned out that they lied and the item would not be available for another month. This company is an absolute joke and so are all of the people that work there. The worst customer service I have ever had the displeasure of dealing with.

Car stereo arrived in bad shape (not Cruchfield fault).  Stereo bracket was supposed to be installed, it wasn’t.  Called support And was refunded.  Support person told me bracket instructions would be emailed, it wasn’t. When originally ordering stereo asked if I needed antenna adapter, they told me no (antenna needed adaptor).  I guess Crutchfield employees are on a quota system because they will sell you anything with no regard if it fits or not.  I’m really disappointed because they use to be a reputable business you could count on....obviously not anymore.

Shipping was slow not 2 days like a pay for it was more like 5days, as of the device performance is terrible, standard volume sucks, notifications are louder than music and if you try to raise your phone volume it hurts the sound quality, connectivity a little tricky
I ordered my speaker and it has been a week now and still have yet to receive it. I had 2 day shipping so I’m wondering if it will even show up or if I just lost $250!

Review.Titre: Thought it sounded funny out of the box…
Review.Contenu: Thought it sounded funny out of the box - I assumed it was just the sound of the aluminum shell, however after banging for over a month, a door speaker blew and I took it in to get changed out at a local Best Buy audio shop. When I played my system for the tech, he immediately noticed the 12 inch in my trunk was sounding funny. His assumption was a voice coil had separated internally due to glue failure.. I told him the sub sounded this way from the moment it was installed and he shook his head at me in disappointment. Guess the prices here are too good to be true!

Review.Titre: Terrible Customer Service & Price Match Scam
Review.Contenu: Terrible Customer Service! Offered a Amazon Price Match. Spent 35 minutes going through the process with a chat representative. They approved the price match and I asked again to confirm and they told me to place my order and they would refund me the difference. After I placed the order, tied up the funds on my credit card, then when they went to refund me the difference they said they made a mistake and can’t price match the Amazon price. Not only did they lie and not honor it, it tied up my credit card funds and wasted an hour of my time. A supervisor refused to honor their mistake. Terrible Support! Buyer beware of their price match scam!

This is not the first order I have placed.   This order I purchased new items. The external shipping box did come sealed however when I opened it I clearly received previously returned items. Three boxes opened, 1 sealed from my order. I immediately called Customer service then continued to look at all items of my order.  I did call back and am now waiting on return labels. The items I did order, however somehow the screen of the unit was much smaller, not what I wanted. when I called back, i went through my issue, I was transferred but this information was not forwarded and the person I talked to had no idea.  So I had to revisit all this information.

Package shipped to completely wrong  address. Wrong town , wrong zip code . Fortunately, Package was found next town away and box was found opened. Fortunately all contents were intact.  Confirmation email showed correct address but shipping label on the package was  wrong. This was not the shipping address I provided.

Review.Titre: Why is Crutchfield listed on the Capital One shopping app if it’s not going to provide any promo offers?
Review.Contenu: Crutchfield was listed as a store on the Capital One shopping app. Not only did I NOT receive any cash back, I also did not receive any of the promo codes as advertised! Unsure if I’ll keep this item, particularly if I find a better deal with another company who will honor their advertisement.

Review.Titre: Well they tell me that I will receive…
Review.Contenu: Well they tell me that I will receive it by the 24 and is 27 already and I have not received yet.. so I am pretty disappointed because of that.

The speaker adapters that were sent were not the correct one and I had to purchase the correct one from a local shop for $30. You could be more effective by making sure that you send the corrected adapter for a 2016 F150 super crew rear door. You could be more effective by making sure that you send the correct adapter for a 6 1/2 round speaker adapter versus the 5x7 adapter you sent.

Ordered a new android auto radio for my truck. Bought the added harness option that included having the factory steering wheel controls work. There were essentially no instructions. Those that were provided were less than helpful. Verified all the dip switch setting and connections were per the instructions. Still don't work.

Still unable to install.  Your instructions suck to put it nicely.  I was doing fine until I got to the wiring.  There are so many extra parts in the box that it’s too confusing to continue.  I realize that my car model has only been around for 24 years and you couldn’t possibly know exactly which parts are needed to replace my radio.  It’s too bad because it would save your company a lot of money.

Review.Titre: JBL Speaker install on my 2016 Jeep Wrangler
Review.Contenu: Speaker install on my 2016 Jeep Wrangler Sport Unlimited had a lot more modifications than what was explained to me when talking to the Tech who made speaker recommendations prior to my purchase. I've made several installs over the years and have been a big JBL fan for more than 40 years. However, the JBL speakers that were recommended and purchased/installed can't handle any bass whatsoever. Very disappointed.

Overall the Crutchfield experience is great - the item was easy to locate, I was able to order and it arrived the next day. So 5 stars for the experience and the customer service - However, I don't know if this review is for the product or the overall experience at Crutchfield - that is vague and shouldn't be. The item (Atlas Y-sum Cable with Europin Connector) did not work with the QSC amplifier I had - the amp did not receive a signal even when I tried to reverse every connection but the cable. The Cable negative contact and jumper are soldered together and felt that disrupting this would void my return. I did read that other buyers had to do this to get the cable working - just shouldn't be necessary for 55$ cable. I'll try to make my own.

Review.Titre: For the first time as a long standing…
Review.Contenu: For the first time as a long standing customer, I received my product in an open box.  However, I ordered it new.

Extremely pathetic customer tech support. They claim to know all about installation of a sound system but haven't a clue when it comes to running speaker wires? What a joke. I was about to spend over 2000$ in equipment but when asked about running wires for amp hook up they did not have a clue. What's the point of lifetime tech support if they can't even help with running wires? They are not the professionals I expected them to be, that's for sure.After 1 call with their tech support i knew they are not the people I was looking for.
Recommended tweeters that were 100% incompatible with my vehicle.  Recommended extra hardware that I didn't need.  Feels like I spent twice the money I should have.

Review.Titre: Good Stereo, bad install kit, not worth the extra money!
Review.Contenu: Let me start off by saying that I like the Kenwood stereo I received. The stereo was a good upgrade from the stereo my car originally had and am happy i purchased it. However one of the reasons I chose to go with crutchfield is the for the installation kit. I was going to order the basic install kit that included the harness needed but saw the pro kit that they were offering and trusted that it would be what I needed to do a proper install and paid the extra cash. It was a total waste of money all I ended up using was the removal tool and the harness and am left with a bunch of instal hardware that is unneeded. Find out specifically what you need for your project and do not trust that Crutchfield knows what that is.
Beware this company does not cover shipping for returns and it will take almost forever to get a complete refund. I was not aware when I made the purchase because of 5 star reviews on their website.

Review.Titre: Cruthfield Heavily Edits Negative Product Reviews
Review.Contenu: My chief complaint against Crutchfield is that they heavily edit customer reviews of their products. For example, I purchased a pair of ELAC tower speakers from Crutchfield that were described as having 6.5" woofers, but upon receiving them, it was clear that they were only 5 1/4 inches in diameter. I double checked to make sure I received the correct models, and I did. The speakers' description online was flatly wrong. They still sounded great, but it sucked that I didn't get what I paid for / expected. So I wrote a critical reviewew to post on their website, complete with a picture of a measurement across the front of the speaker to prove my point. But Crutchfield REFUSED to post the picture and heavily edited my review to make it sound like I was just confused about measurements. It was very frustrating and proves that you can't trust them to be honest or rely on their redacted user "reviews."

Review.Titre: Mount didn't fit speaker and needed to…
Review.Contenu: Mount didn't fit speaker and needed to be modified. Speaker didn't fix the door and the needed to be heavily modified. Electrically harness wasn't used but was incorrect.

The customer service representative I dealt with I believe he nam was Magen was professional knowledgeable and I would say the best customer service person I have ever encountered . I would enthusiastically recommend your company to others based upon the experience I had with Megan in rectifying my issue.I can’t say enough how good a job she did.

Review.Titre: I bought the unit to replace a more…expensive one that failed after 5 years of usage
Review.Contenu: I bought the unit to replace a more expensive broken Kenwood radio.  To be fair, this replacement is 1/4 of the price of the previous one.  I have had that radio for about 6 months.The good: very easy to install (direct replacement including steering controls), the installation kit is well made, large display with decent colors (but missing the one I wanted to fit my car), good spectrum of options (inputs).  Amazing service from Crutchfield adviser during the whole process.The bad (in order): the software freezes quite often and I have to park the car and restart the engine to reset the radio (quite frustrating); sound quality is average at best (compare to my previous one which was really great) with little dynamic (sound like FM radio even with 24 bits stuff) - no, sound adjustment did not solve it; clock display is never right (despite setting the right option); front glass is too much reflective and difficult to read in day time (sun); customization of the display could be much better (compare to my previous model);  Can you have better for about $600, I don't know but I should have paid more.  I do not recommend but if you only have $600 that might be a decent option if you are ready to leave with the cons...

Review.Titre: Disappointed by kit for my car
Review.Contenu: I go to Crutchfield because they sell you kits that are customized for your individual vehicle - or, at least they say they do. But in my case (2008 Toyota Highlander), the rear door adapter plates by Scosche were completely unusable, the instructions completely incorrect (as acknowledged by a customer support person when he checked the field team's photos), and the nuts, bolts and screws mostly unusable. Why am I not receiving the correct hardware and instructions? The customer support by phone was good, though.
You advertise 2day shipping/delivery to USA.It has been way longer than that...

Review.Titre: Supported Options Need to be Clearer for a given car
Review.Contenu: The process of shopping for and selecting the combination of parts is not as easy as it's made out to be. It's confusing and unclear when it comes to what's actually supported in a given car. The support person did not seem all that interested in helping me, it felt like I was bothering him by calling in to ask questions when I was going through the instructions and finding that they were not clear when it came to support for backup cameras and bluetooth. Even the support person didn't know the answer to whether factory bluetooth would be supported (even though the answer was 'yes' according to the website). And, now, after going through and finally finding that the backup camera in my vehicle is not supported, and realizing that that pretty much negates the whole deal because it's an integral function of the existing system... I have to pay to have all of this shipped back to Crutchfield. It should be made much CLEARER at the point of sale when there are features as important as existing backup cameras that are not supported. At the end of the day, however, if Crutchfield at least had an adapter for the existing camera, my experience would be different, and maybe I wouldn't have had to be connected with lackluster support personnel.

Review.Titre: Don’t like the fact that I have to pay…
Review.Contenu: Don’t like the fact that I have to pay for return shipping. When a person want to exchange a item. I wanted to exchange an item to but another one and now I have to pay 70.00. Amazon and ABT is free returns.

Review.Titre: Free 2 day shipping and 6 days later…
Review.Contenu: Free 2 day shipping and 6 days later it’s still hasn’t arrived. But I’m hopeful that everything else will be good.

Review.Titre: Tim with Crutchfield was horrible to…

To make matters worse he commented "oh my god" under his breath when asking the last question about compatibility. I immediately hung up the phone and was appalled. Crutchfield overall is okay but Tim who has been with Crutchfield 12+ years should be working warehouse and avoid sales or customer service at all costs!

Ordered a speaker last week and everything went smooth...order, fast shipping...great!  Went to place an order for a second today and I can log into my account, but not pull up any details.  Then when I place the order the address wizard says that my town does not exist...after I just shipped an item here this past week.  Tried to get customer service involved, however they are closed for the night.  What a pain in the ass this second order is turning out to be.

When I called to report the failure the same tech advised that they may not have thoroughly tested the interface but offered no help.Now I’m out $267.00 for a used OEM amplifier and very disappointed

Appreciate the Crutchfield level of detailed data on their products along with reviews and support over the years.  But please don’t claim I will see my order in 2 days and then take 5+… still hasn’t arrived, ruined my weekend plans, I so wish I had purchased elsewhere.

Review.Titre: 3 Day shipping is more like 7-8 days…
Review.Contenu: 3 Day shipping is more like 7-8 days upon receiving. Shipping company will not call to schedule so just hope someone is home. Still waiting on product file very here

Review.Titre: Open box item bad on arrival
Review.Contenu: I ordered an open box subwoofer and found out 3 days later that it had a bad voice coil. I believed that the components had been tested prior to being sold. The good thing out of the situation is that a new one was sent out the next day. I must say the customer service was great and made a bad situation a little bit better.

Difficult instillation of speakers. Drilling of holes and splicing with existing speaker wire was bad enough, but the speakers had an interference issue when placed without a gasket of some fashion used as a spacer. I was not expecting them to be anything crazy good for 40 bucks but hopefully an improvement on the 16yo paper OEM setup being replaced. I was wrong. Even after breaking them in, the new kenwoods have no base and ear shattering treble that the on board EQ settings. This was likely due in part to the poor attachment of the speakers to the door paneling.

Delivery was terrible.  I didn't upgrade for faster delivery because your site said it would be here Saturday.  It showed up Monday.  I needed it so I could install Sunday.  I would have paid if your page was accurate,  Now I have to wait weeks to install

Review.Titre: Your associated company uses FedX and…

Good pricing and convenience. The extra service with connections done for you is worth the price, but they will NOT make all connections for you, apparently. I had to spend approx 2 hours trying to figure out the other 5 wires needed to fully implement all connections for steering wheel controls. Didn't get it done due to frustration and time limits. I'll take another swing at it this fall.

I bought WH-CH710N's, they rubbed my ears 'till they were sore. Called Tech Support, no solutions. Bought Sony WH-1000XM4's, rubbed my ears till sore. I'm returning both. Discover Crutch now has a $12.00 return fee, ok. So, I call CS and ask for a label to return for both pairs to save some coin (reasonable request). I'm told "no return in separate boxes" I'm out $24.00 and no headphones . So my beloved Crutchfield now sees return fees as a profit center. Not what I've come to expect the guys and gals in C'Ville. Found what I needed at Sweetwater. Sad.

Fast shipping. Love the speakers but the adapters for the door spearkers did not work at all (had to drill holes in door that left a gap around the speakers. Defeats the purpose of adapters) also i have a 05 impreza and the speaker harnesses they sent was for a Mazda which didn't fit either.  Had to hook speakers up and figure out polarity old school way which is a pain on small speakers. Could not find a correct wiring diagram online.  This was my 1st bad experience with crutchfield

Review.Titre: The radio I ordered from Crutchfield…

There will have to be significant cutting, trimming and modifying of my vehicle to make the radio fit which I will have to figure out myself. The installation brackets are wrong and don't fit. I do not know what vehicle they are for, but its not mine. I went with Crutchfield to avoid all this, yet here we are.

Review.Titre: To be honest I ordered a separate…
Review.Contenu: To be honest I ordered a separate double din player for my 03 Chevy Silverado and I had the option to have the wire connections pre made. I did not really see a option for that on this purchase which helps out so much on the installing part of the whole thing.. other than that everything else was good I still have yet to wire it all together
